meanings.definition: Characterized by or involving a series of gradual stages or changes.
meanings.sent1: The gradational increase in temperature made the day feel warmer and warmer.
meanings.sent2: The gradational growth of the plant could be seen as it slowly reached towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The gradational change in color of the chameleon's skin was so slow, it almost seemed like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her mood shifted in a gradational manner, starting from slight annoyance and ending in full-blown anger.
meanings.sent5: The gradational shift from day to night painted the sky in a beautiful array of colors.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to gradation or progression.
meanings.sent1: The gradational music playlist smoothly transitioned from one song to the next.
meanings.sent2: His gradational improvement in math was evident from his increasing test scores.
meanings.sent3: The gradational flow of the river was so calming to watch on a lazy afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The gradational change in scenery as they drove through the countryside was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The gradational shift in power dynamics within the group was subtle but significant.

meanings.definition: Showing a gradual transition or progression.
meanings.sent1: The gradational shift in the painting's colors created a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent2: The gradational change in the character's attitude throughout the story was well-developed.
meanings.sent3: The gradational increase in the number of stars visible as night fell was truly stunning.
meanings.sent4: The gradational rise of the hot air balloon gave passengers a unique view of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The gradational progression of the marathon allowed runners to pace themselves effectively.
